components

Class PairingHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • components.PairingHeap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Heap

    public class PairingHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Heap
    Provides the basic implementation of a maximum pairing heap. It contains the typical methods expected from a maximum heap - insertion, returning the maximum value, deleting maximum and increasing key.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PairingHeap()
      Constructor for the pairing heap.

      • PairingHeap

        public PairingHeap()
        Constructor for the pairing heap. At the start, the root is set to null.

    • Method Detail

      • makePairingHeap

        public PairingHeap makePairingHeap()
        Creates and returns a new pairing heap.
        Returns:
        a new pairing heap.

      • getRoot

        public PairingNode getRoot()
        Returns the root node of the heap.
        Returns:

      • returnMax

        public int returnMax()
        Returns the maximum value of the heap.
        Specified by:
        returnMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value of the heap.

      • deleteMax

        public int deleteMax()
        Deletes the maximum value of the heap and returns it. After deletion, all the remaining nodes need to be built into a new heap via the linkSiblings operation.
        Specified by:
        deleteMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value of the heap.

      • insert

        public void insert(int newValue)
        Inserts a new value into the heap. Insertion requires the new node to be melded into the heap i.e. if the new node is not the new root node, it will become one of the subroots of the root node.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Heap
        Parameters:
        newValue - the value to be inserted into the heap.

      • meld

        public PairingNode meld(PairingNode firstRoot,
                        PairingNode secondRoot)
        Melds two roots into one. The root that has the larger key will become the new root. The other will become a subroot to the new root.
        Parameters:
        firstRoot - first root to be melded.
        secondRoot - second root to melded.
        Returns:
        the melded root.

      • linkSiblings

        public PairingNode linkSiblings(PairingNode startingNode)
        Links separate roots together to form a new pairing heap. The two-pass procedure starts by melding two consecutive separate roots into pairs after which during the second pass the pairs are melded into the last pair (or individual root) formed on the first pass.
        Parameters:
        startingNode - the node from which the linking starts.
        Returns:
        the new node that satisfies the heap condition.

      • increaseKey

        public void increaseKey(PairingNode nodeToIncrease,
                        int newKey)
        Increases the key value of the given node.
        Parameters:
        nodeToIncrease - the node of which key is to be increased.
        newKey - the new value of the key.

      • doubleArraySize

        public PairingNode[] doubleArraySize(PairingNode[] siblingArray)
        Doubles the size of the given array.
        Parameters:
        siblingArray - the array of which size needs to be doubled.
        Returns:
        the double-sized array.
